alert.note: Alert for Chase; Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 8:51AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Chase and northeastern Marion Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 850 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Americus to 5 miles northwest of Marion. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion, Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Lincolnville, Elmdale, Hymer, Pilsen, Saffordville, Tallgrass Prairie and Tallgrass Prairie Preserve. This includes Interstate 35 near Mile Marker 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Pockets of heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
